Html:
Used SQL Powerdoc successfully at my last job. Ran it at my new job and 4 out of 9 servers got the "No Machines Found Error". One common factor on all 4 machines was that SQL Configuration manager would fail to load and give a "Cannot connect to WMI provider..." error. Run the following in a CMD window (as administrator) and it will fix both:

mofcomp "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Shared\sqlmgmproviderxpsp2up.mof".

For more info:
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/956013/en-us
http://www.mssqltips.com/sqlservertip/2382/sql-server-configuration-manager-cannot-connect-to-wmi-provider/
